hints.title: Entanglement and Curvature
hints.content:
3361: :label: prop-entanglement-curvature
3362: 
3363: For a bipartite quantum system with subsystems $A$ and $B$, the Bures curvature at a quantum critical point satisfies:
3364: 
3365: $$
3366: R_{\text{Bures}} \sim S_{\text{ent}}^2
3367: $$
3368: 
3369: where $S_{\text{ent}} = -\text{Tr}_A(\rho_A \log \rho_A)$ is the **entanglement entropy** of subsystem $A$.

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-17
hints.content:
3374: :::{prf:proof}
3375: 
3376: **Step 1**: Entanglement contribution to Fisher information.
3377: 
3378: The quantum Fisher information detects entanglement via:
3379: 
3380: $$
3381: g_{\text{Bures}}^{\theta\theta} = 4\sum_{m \neq n} \frac{|\langle m | \partial_\theta \hat{\rho} | n \rangle|^2}{\rho_m + \rho_n}
3382: $$
3383: 
3384: For highly entangled states, the off-diagonal matrix elements $\langle m | \partial_\theta \hat{\rho} | n \rangle$ are large (many states participate in the transition).
3385: 
3386: **Step 2**: Curvature scaling.
3387: 
3388: The Bures curvature involves second derivatives of the metric, which scale as:
3389: 
3390: $$
3391: R \sim \frac{\partial^2 g}{\partial \theta^2} \sim \frac{\partial^2 S_{\text{ent}}}{\partial \theta^2}
3392: $$
3393: 
3394: At a quantum critical point, entanglement entropy exhibits a logarithmic divergence:
3395: 
3396: $$
3397: S_{\text{ent}} \sim c \log L
3398: $$
